results.title: Cycle of life
results.creator_credit: Peter Mills, Random Films and Soil Association
results.brief_description: An analysis of past and present human folly in exploiting and destroying the vitality of the soil. The film commences with the story of the fall of ancient civilizations. To avoid the disasters of the past, humans, as an integral part of nature, must obey the laws of life. The film claims that husbandry, based on an awareness of our inseparable partnership with nature, leads to the promotion of health and vitality in soil, and so in plant, in animal and in humans thereby completing the “cycle of life”.

results.title: Cycle logic - cycle safety
results.creator_credit: Aerospace Audio-Visual Services and F M Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates safe operation and handling of motor-cycles. Shows how to start, clutch, brake and accelerate. Explains anticipation riding in entering intersections, taking curves, changing lanes, keeping safe distances and avoiding road hazards. Covers city, country road and freeway conditions. Also stresses the importance of protective clothing and good posture.

results.title: Cybernetica
results.creator_credit: Peter M Sims, James Ritchie and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Three young women converge on Paris, exploring as they travel, the wonders of a new age; the new railway age in which computers defeat by the speed of their decision making and contemporary evils of congestion, pollution and wasted space and time. “We can travel all we want, yet leave the land, the air and the sunshine undisturbed.”

results.title: The Use of operational research - Part 1 cutting the queue
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basis for Decision”.
Operational research calculates the probable results of alternate courses of action for planning purposes. Many problems of organisations have similar structures and can be solved by similar methods of analysis and similar mathematical models. One simple structure, the input-service- output situation, is discussed and applied to different queuing problems.

results.title: Cutting oils and fluids
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Crabb, Michael Barden and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: The composition and qualities of the various types of water-based fluids and neat cutting oils; their function, the importance of selecting the right one for the job, and the benefits derived from good housekeeping and hygiene.

results.title: Cut or mix
results.creator_credit: Gordon Severn and Centre for Educational Television Overseas
results.brief_description: Shows situations in television production in which the choice between a cut and a mix has to be made and gives some guidelines to assist the director in making the correct decision. In many cases the exact timing of a cut can be important, and examples are shown and explained in detail, showing cutting on action and on change of ideas. Intended for trainee television producers.

results.title: The Cut of your job
results.brief_description: This film is intended to illustrate the importance of good and appropriate clothing for salesmen. The story is of an unsuccessful salesman who could not get promotion until he is taken in hand by a fellow traveller who persuades him to improve his appearance by wearing better chosen and more appropriate clothing. He is shown choosing a hat, suit and tie and the reason of his choice is explained. The result builds his self confidence and he is then successful in his work.

results.title: A Curriculum based on child development
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Elementary School Teacher Education”.
Projects undertaken by typical fourth-grade students are used in explaining the methods employed by an elementary school teacher to adapt the curriculum to the needs of her pupils. Points out that the developmental characteristics of pre-adolescents must be considered in all phases of the curriculum.

results.title: Current and electromotive force
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Radio Technician Training”.
Explains the electron theory, discussing arrangement of molecules, building up of current conductors, electromotive force, resistance and chemical and mechanical sources of electromotive force.
